intro: Orthaea crinita, commonly known as the silky orthaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hair-covered stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
